intro: Rumex stenophyllus var. ussuriensis, commonly known as the Ussuri dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern regions of Russia and parts of northeastern China. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive reddish or purple coloration on the underside, and it produces small, greenish flowers in clusters. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their astringent properties. The plant is characterized by its robust root system and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
